comment.author: 22575440@N07
comment._content: just wonderful! would love to see a modern day shot of the same view. Much has changed for sure!

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I reckon it was a laundry van with those baskets?  I agree with Tammybeck it would be great to try and recreate it.  I'm out on the northside and can't get past immigration.

comment.author: 50889628@N08
comment._content: I’m thinking the van would transport anything you needed to have moved, maybe even people.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Well, we could try to get authorisation for you to come Southside! And laundry is a great idea.

comment._content: Hi. I believe your 'street view' should be further back. note the roof parapets to buildings on left. View Larger Map

comment.author: 47290943@N03

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: Whitechurch Laundry Co Limited had a telephone number Rathfarnham 9 in 1913 - you can also see a ch in one of the baskets, so I say the cart is from that Laundry. www.lennonwylie.co.uk/1913PhoneList13.htm

comment.author: 110940412@N04
comment._content: My mother told me this was the the Whitechurch Laundry van when she saw the photo years ago. The Laundry was owned by her uncles William and Arthur Willoughby. They also had depots in Blessington St and Charlemont Street. Quality of the photo is briliiant.
